Steve Bjorg wrote:
> 
> 
> I didn't realize that Web3S was proposing adding a HTTP verb, namely 
> UPDATE [1].  In light of the recent discussions around partial PUTs, is 
> UPDATE something to consider?  How should it differ from PATCH?  Also, I 
> probably confused here, but isn't it the same author behind both these 
> verbs (i.e. Yaron Goland)?

(all imho)

1) UPDATE is something to consider.

2) PATCH is supposed to have the desired semantics, so UPDATE wouldn't 
be needed (it's a bad name anyway, as PUT already has update semantics, 
the key difference is that it's *partial*).

3) No. Yaron didn't work on PATCH (yet?).

Best regards, Julian
